title: >>> The NEW AGE
body_text:
DODGEBALL X left its mark on this great sport, no question. The feedback has been very positive to say the least. Here is what several players had to say about this epic event:
"On a scale of 1 to 10, I'd have to rate DODGEBALL X to be about a 9. It would be better if the teams were a bit more evenly matched in terms of number of players. I forget the exact numbering, but I believe that we were short two players at all times. Otherwise, best ever. Hands down."
- DAN SPENGEMAN
"I would have to say that X was definitely a 10 for me. I know it's only my second game, but it was so much more fun this time around. And the pics are great. Gotta love 'em!"
- KATHLEEN REINHARD
"10. I think it really showed that people love dodgeball, especially since people went out of there way to get gifts for (John). I mean we know that they come to play because they like to play; big difference between love and like. This just reassured everything."
- DIANA DIBUCCIO
"Between the awards, surprises, and extra playing time, I'd give it a solid 10, or a solid 'X' I should say. It was only my 3rd event so I don't have all that much to compare it to, but it was the best I'd been to."
- TOM ADAMS
"Dodgeball. What a genius idea, bringing together friends and new friends and of course great times together. How could you not rate DODGEBALL X a 10? I can't believe what dodgeball has become. DODGEBALL X was the icing on the cake."
- VALERIE WINSTON
~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~
Perhaps these moments will bring back mental pictures for everyone ...
DODGEBALL DAY 4
The power of one Mike Rozz was stopped even for one second as Valerie instinctively catches one of his fastballs with her thighs.
DODGEBALL 8
Tom Adams becomes the first player in history to be "carried" off the court during gameplay. This was because he was on the receiving end of [arguably] the worst "nut" shot in dodgeball's short history.
D-DAY VI
Joey K, Dan K, and Chris D feel the power of the "Turtles Ball" as face shots and "nut" shots galore. Since the event, the "Turtles Ball" has become extinct. This night also had the most players ever with 30.
DODGEBALL DAY 1
The very first dodgeball event takes place. It was an impromtu tryout, one that obviously worked out.
D-DAY 5
The invasion of "The Rats" (middle school kids) sends Chris Adams over the edge as he does an infamous "crabwalk" in retaliation to their antics.
DODGEBALL DAY 3
In one of the biggest shockers in dodgeball history, Kathryn Nogueira eliminates KJohn twice in one night.
DODGEBALL VII
The first "Wet War" takes place as 15 courageous competitors made their way to Ocean Road Park in the pouring rain. Valerie W vs. Lauren F, both captains on this night, becomes one of the most famous rivalries of all time.
DODGEBALL 9
The second "Wet War" occurs as another windy and rainy night creates more memories for the 19 players in attendance.
DODGEBALL DAY 2
Success of this second night of play brings up the idea, now a reality, of dodgeball becoming a weekly event.
~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~
Dodgeball has become a big part of many of our lives. There has been 10 successful events, all of which bringing friends together. As for DODGEBALL X, it will unquestionably be one of the most memorable, competitive, and overall fun dodgeball events ever.
However, dodgeball is not going anywhere.
The future awaits us all as we are ushered into a new era ...

DODGEBALL X left its mark on this great sport, no question. The feedback has been very positive to say the least. Here is what several players had to say about this epic event:

"On a scale of 1 to 10, I'd have to rate DODGEBALL X to be about a 9. It would be better if the teams were a bit more evenly matched in terms of number of players. I forget the exact numbering, but I believe that we were short two players at all times. Otherwise, best ever. Hands down."
- DAN SPENGEMAN

"I would have to say that X was definitely a 10 for me. I know it's only my second game, but it was so much more fun this time around. And the pics are great. Gotta love 'em!"
- KATHLEEN REINHARD

"10. I think it really showed that people love dodgeball, especially since people went out of there way to get gifts for (John). I mean we know that they come to play because they like to play; big difference between love and like. This just reassured everything."
- DIANA DIBUCCIO

"Between the awards, surprises, and extra playing time, I'd give it a solid 10, or a solid 'X' I should say. It was only my 3rd event so I don't have all that much to compare it to, but it was the best I'd been to."
- TOM ADAMS

"Dodgeball. What a genius idea, bringing together friends and new friends and of course great times together. How could you not rate DODGEBALL X a 10? I can't believe what dodgeball has become. DODGEBALL X was the icing on the cake."
- VALERIE WINSTON

Success of this second night of play brings up the idea, now a reality, of dodgeball becoming a weekly event.

Dodgeball has become a big part of many of our lives. There has been 10 successful events, all of which bringing friends together. As for DODGEBALL X, it will unquestionably be one of the most memorable, competitive, and overall fun dodgeball events ever.

However, dodgeball is not going anywhere.

The future awaits us all as we are ushered into a new era ...
